results.title: Movies to Stream for Martin Luther King Jr. Day
‘One Night in Miami’ Review: After the Big Fight, a War of Words
results.abstract: A 1964 meeting of Malcolm X, Cassius Clay, Sam Cooke and Jim Brown is the subject of Regina King’s riveting directorial debut.

multimedia.caption: A moment in time: A scene from Regina King’s “One Night in Miami.” Kingsley Ben-Adir, left, as Malcolm X, taking a photo of Jim Brown (Aldis Hodge), Cassius Clay (Eli Goree) and Sam Cooke (Leslie Odom Jr.).

Pixar’s ‘Soul’ Has a Black Hero. In Denmark, a White Actor Dubs the Voice.
results.abstract: The casting has fueled a debate about racism and fanned anger about stereotyping and prejudice in European-language voice-overs, even when films have main characters of color.

results.title: Barbara Shelley, Leading Lady of Horror Films, Dies at 88
results.abstract: Sometimes the victim, sometimes the monster, she was a frequent presence in scary movies in the 1950s and ’60s. She died of underlying conditions following a bout with the coronavirus.

multimedia.caption: Barbara Shelley was an elegant queen of camp in a succession of British horror movies. She appeared with Christopher Lee in the 1966 film “Dracula: Prince of Darkness.”
